alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 17 at 2:48PM MST until December 19 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...West to southwest winds 35 to 50 MPH with gusts up to 75 MPH possible. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills including Arlington and Elk Mountain along Interstate 80 between Laramie and Rawlins. * WHEN...Winds will continue to dissipate through this afternoon before ramping back up this evening. After this brief lull, a prolonged period of strong winds will occur from 9 PM MST tonight through at least 5 PM MST Sunday. The strongest winds are expected from Saturday afternoon through early Sunday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. There will be a high risk for vehicle blow overs, particularly along north to south oriented roadways.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.
